direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods search for elements containing specific text, but one uses a regular expression and the other uses a literal string.
Both methods use regular expressions to match text within elements, but one focuses on the element's own text while the other includes descendant text.
Both methods match elements based on text patterns, but one uses a compiled regular expression and the other compiles a regular expression from a string.
Both methods search for elements containing specific text, but one includes descendant text while the other focuses only on the element's own text.
The select method uses CSS selectors to find elements, which can be used to achieve similar results as text-based searches but with different syntax.
The select method with an Evaluator can be used to create custom search criteria, which can be similar to text-based searches but more flexible.
The selectFirst method can be used to find the first element matching a CSS selector, which can be related to finding elements by text but with different criteria.
The selectFirst method with an Evaluator can be used to find the first element matching custom criteria, which can be related to text-based searches.
The expectFirst method is similar to selectFirst but throws an exception if no match is found, which can be related to finding elements by text.
The closest method finds the closest ancestor matching a CSS selector, which can be related to finding elements by text but with different criteria.
The closest method with an Evaluator can be used to find the closest ancestor matching custom criteria, which can be related to text-based searches.
The selectXpath method uses XPath expressions to find elements, which can be used to achieve similar results as text-based searches but with different syntax.
The selectXpath method with a node type can be used to find specific types of nodes matching an XPath expression, which can be related to text-based searches.
